str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 1st Person Plural
str2: Our, our own. From thnetos; our.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Necessary, essential, intimate, right, proper. From anagke; necessary; by implication, close.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
